reason: The article discusses the use of bagasse, Coffee husk and Khat to produce energy briquettes with high caloric value, aiming to reduce pollution and support sustainable development goals. The focus on waste-to-energy conversion aligns with circular economy and solid waste management themes.

The article discusses the conversion of potato waste into starch and bioplastic, highlighting a sustainable approach to reduce waste and produce valuable materials. It touches on various SDGs such as affordable energy, industry innovation, sustainable cities, responsible consumption, and life below water, but does not delve deeply into any one area.

The article discusses the establishment of vermin-sheds to produce high-quality soil amendments through vermicomposting and vermi-tea production. This project aims to utilize solid organic wastes from households and open markets, promoting a circular economy approach to sustainable urbanization.

The article discusses the design and development of avocado and mango fruit packaging materials, focusing on sustainable solutions for reducing waste and promoting circular economy principles. The content aligns with the Sustainable Cities and Communities SDG and Solid Waste Management thematic areas.

The article discusses the production of particleboard using coffee parchment as a reinforcement component to partially replace wood particles in conventional board standards. This innovative approach aims to utilize solid waste, reducing waste management issues and promoting sustainable development.

The article discusses the conversion of sugarcane bagasse into pulp and paper bags, focusing on industry, innovation, and infrastructure standards. It highlights the importance of these standards for sustainable development in the production process.

The article discusses the conversion of tannery solid waste into a value-added construction material, highlighting the potential for innovation and infrastructure development in the industry. It also touches on the importance of circular economy and jobs, as well as solid waste management.

The article discusses Dr. Nambi's work on creating multinutritional feeds for livestock, which is a significant contribution to improving productivity in the agriculture sector. The focus on enhancing feed quality aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of Zero Hunger and Responsible Consumption and Production.

The article discusses Azoverm, a nano-formulated organic soil amendment developed by researchers at Makerere University. It explains how Azoverm balances pH, improves organic matter content, and allows for slow release of nutrients to plants, minimizing environmental leakages. The solution is aligned with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly Zero Hunger, Good Health and Well-being, Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure, and Life on Land.

The article presents an innovative irrigation system called Smart O' that aims to facilitate agriculture in Africa. It features remote control, scheduling, and automation of irrigation systems, which can lead to increased crop yields and productivity. The device is designed for easy access and use, making it accessible to farmers. The article highlights the benefits of this technology, including its potential to achieve several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
